greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered ways to write 2n+1 as a sum of 3 odd primes.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: nn = 100; lim = 2*nn + 17; ps = Prime[Range[2, nn + 1]]; t = Table[0, {lim}]; Do[s = i + j + k; If[s <= lim, t[[s]]++], {i, ps}, {j, ps}, {k, ps}]; Take[t, {1, lim, 2}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Apr 10 2014 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=0, 100, t=2*n+1; c=0; for(k=2, t, for(l=2, t, for(m=2, t, tt=prime(k)+prime(l)+prime(m); if(tt>2*n+1, break); if(tt==2*n+1, c=c+1)))); print1(c", "))
results.author: _Ralf Stephan_, Oct 18 2003
ext: Leading zeros added by _T. D. Noe_, Apr 10 2014
